# dokploy_deployments (Data Source)

Fetches deployment history from Dokploy. Specify exactly one of application_id, compose_id, or server_id to filter deployments.



<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Optional

- `application_id` (String) Filter deployments by application ID.
- `compose_id` (String) Filter deployments by compose ID.
- `server_id` (String) Filter deployments by server ID.

### Read-Only

- `deployments` (Attributes List) List of deployments. (see [below for nested schema](#nestedatt--deployments))

<a id="nestedatt--deployments"></a>
### Nested Schema for `deployments`

Read-Only:

- `application_id` (String) Application ID if this is an application deployment.
- `backup_id` (String) Backup ID if this is a backup deployment.
- `build_server_id` (String) Build server ID if a remote build server was used.
- `compose_id` (String) Compose ID if this is a compose deployment.
- `created_at` (String) Timestamp when the deployment was created.
- `description` (String) Description of the deployment.
- `error_message` (String) Error message if the deployment failed.
- `finished_at` (String) Timestamp when the deployment finished (null if still running).
- `id` (String) The unique identifier of the deployment.
- `is_preview_deployment` (Boolean) Whether this is a preview deployment.
- `log_path` (String) Path to the deployment log file.
- `preview_deployment_id` (String) Preview deployment ID if applicable.
- `rollback_id` (String) Rollback ID if this is a rollback deployment.
- `schedule_id` (String) Schedule ID if this was a scheduled deployment.
- `server_id` (String) Server ID if this is a server deployment.
- `started_at` (String) Timestamp when the deployment started.
- `status` (String) Status of the deployment: running, done, error.
- `title` (String) Title of the deployment (e.g., 'Manual deployment').
- `volume_backup_id` (String) Volume backup ID if this is a volume backup deployment.
